titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Frederick Knott Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday May 7, 2019 at 03:00

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of material created and accumulated by Frederick Knott in the course of his activities as a playwright and screenwriter. Material includes drafts of scripts, production photographs, printed ephemera and audiovisual recordings. Writings include drafts of stage and film versions of Dial M for Murder, and photographs, contracts and other documentation of the film version directed by Alfred Hitchcock. Other material documents the writing and production of Wait Until Dark and Write Me a Murder. A small amount of student papers in Series III (Personal Papers) and writings dating from Knott's childhood document his early life.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from the Estate of Frederick Knott on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2005.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Access to original audiovisual recordings is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Frederick Knott Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Frederick Knott Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization.

As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Frederick Knott, 1916-2002
bioghist.p: Frederick Major Paull Knott, playwright and screenwriter, was born August 28, 1916 in Hankow, China to British missionary parents. He was sent to England at the age of ten for schooling, and he entered Cambridge University in 1934, where he excelled at tennis. During the Second World War, Knott served served as an artillery officer in the British army. After the war, Knott turned to writing and his first play was produced in 1952. He authored the plays Dial M for Murder and Wait Until Dark , which were enormously successful on Broadway and in London's West End in the 1950s and 1960s. He also wrote the screenplay for the film version of Dial M for Murder , which was directed by Alfred Hitchcock in 1954. Knott died in New York on December 17, 2002.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of material created and accumulated by Frederick Knott in the course of his activities as a playwright and screenwriter. Material includes drafts of scripts, production photographs, printed ephemera and audiovisual recordings. Writings include drafts of stage and film versions of Dial M for Murder , and photographs, contracts and other documentation of the film version directed by Alfred Hitchcock. Other material documents the writing and production of Wait Until Dark and Write Me a Murder . A small amount of student papers in Series III (Personal Papers) and writings dating from Knott's childhood document his early life.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into six series: I. Correspondence, 1951-1992. II. Writings, 1927-2002. III. Personal Papers, 1923-2003. IV. Printed Material, 1941-circa 1999. V. Photographs, circa 1920-1979. VI. Audiovisual Material, 1984-2002.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence is fragmentary and includes family correspondence as well as letters and records relating to writers' organizations to which Knott belonged.
Correspondence files relating to specific works are filed in Series II (Writings).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Relating to "Dial M for Murder," London production

did.unittitle: National Assembly of Authors and Dramatists

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by title. Untitled and unidentified writings are filed at the end of the series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Writings consist chiefly of autograph manuscript and typescript drafts, many annotated, of scripts for stage and film. Many files also include notes, correspondence, photographs, clippings, and other related papers. Of particular interest are the files relating to Dial M for Murder , which include shooting scripts for the film directed by Alfred Hitchcock, and photographs that document the production of the film.
In addition to playscripts and screenplays, the series includes drafts of early short stories, as indicated on folder titles.

arrangement.p: Not arranged in any particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Personal papers consist of financial papers, official documents, transcripts of interviews, and fragmentary documentation of Frederick Knott's early life, including photographs and educational records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series consists chiefly of unsorted playbills and clippings, and also includes Frederick Knott's annotated copy of the Little Oxford Dictionary .

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Prints and Slides.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs depict Frederick Knott's childhood in China and early adulthood in England, and several stage and film productions, including Alfred Hitchcock's 1954 film Dial M for Murder .
Photographs relating to a particular work can also be found in Series II.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 44-45 and 48 (audiovisual material): Resticted fragile. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Audiovisual material documents stage and television productions of Dial M for Murder and Wait Until Dark , and interviews with Frederick Knott.
